Posts.Content: Mar 11, 2012 05:59AM mb1024 wrote: I was just told two days ago that I have invasive ductal carcinoma - a 1.5 cm tumor in the left breast, and another little tumor in a node under my arm.  I had mamo (this had to have been invented by a man), the aspiration needles (feels like a mosquito bite - yeah, right), chest X-ray and they took lots of blood.  Still to come is a PET scan and MRI.  Right now, the Dr. is saying stage 2a, depending on how the other tests come back (which is freaking me out, by the way).  As she drew pictures and diagrams, all I kept saying was, "am I going to lose my hair??"  So my head was not on straight at the time.  She said I would probably be a good candidate for a lumpectomy, followed by radiation and chemo.  Now, as I read stuff and talk to people who have had BC, I'm thinking maybe I should have a mastectomy if it will lower my risk of recurrence.  I'll have to write down questions and discuss this with the Dr. after all the reports are in, and show her that sometimes I do have a brain in my head.  I agree with everyone that the waiting is the hardest.  Even though I got a lot done the other day at the hospital, I can't stand waiting to have the other tests done, and then waiting to talk to the doctor.  I'm imagining myself lighting up like a Christmas tree during the PET scan!  I was a very bad girl, and had not been to a doctor in YEARS!  Never had a mamo before (I'm almost 62), or any other tests, for that matter.  A little embarrassing when being asked, "when was the last time you had...."   "Uh....never."  I am a living example of why we should get checked.  I was lucky that my boss' wife just happens to be a nurse practitioner in the breast center of one of our local hospitals.  She got me in there the morning after I found "THE LUMP," I was there all day, and was told I was positive the same day.  I will end now because I'm starting to ramble, but I'm very glad I found this site.  Reading all of your posts, and sharing my experience is lessening the constant nervous feeling in my stomach.
Posts.Title: Had masectomy a week ago...unsure what's next chapter4 MTnester
